alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 12:06PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Cherokee County through 1245 PM CDT... At 1206 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Gaylesville, or 8 miles east of Little River Canyon National Preserve, moving south at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Centre, Cedar Bluff, Little River Canyon National Preserve, Forney, Centre Municipal Airport, Leesburg, Gaylesville, Tennala, Pleasant Gap, Cornwall Furnace Park, Blanche, Eastern Weiss Lake, Little River Falls, Western Weiss Lake, Moshat, Ball Flat, Coloma, Weiss Dam, Yellow Creek Falls and Spring Garden. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
